Begin by creating a new coordinate system at [0, 0, 0] with no rotation. For the sketch, create a rectangle with four lines on face 1. * Line 1: Start Point [0, 0], End Point [0.75, 0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0], End Point [0.75, 0.4687] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.4687], End Point [0, 0.4687] * Line 4: Start Point [0, 0.4687], End Point [0, 0] Extrude the sketch by 0.0562 units in the normal direction. **Part 2** Create a cutout on the sloped side of the prism from the previous step. Create a new coordinate system at [0.0375, 0.0375, 0.0562] with no rotation. For the sketch, create a rectangle with four lines on face 1. * Line 1: Start Point [0, 0], End Point [0.675, 0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.675, 0], End Point [0.675, 0.3938] * Line 3: Start Point [0.675, 0.3938], End Point [0, 0.3938] * Line 4: Start Point [0, 0.3938], End Point [0, 0] Extrude the sketch by 0.0281 units in the opposite direction of the normal. **Part 3** Add a cylindrical feature to the top of the prism from step 2. Create a new coordinate system at [0.3469, 0.3399, 0.0842] with no rotation. For the sketch, create a circle on face 1. * Circle: Center [0.0281, 0.0281], Radius 0.0281 Extrude the circle by 0.0281 units in the normal direction.</description>

Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. 3. Sketch a quadrilateral as follows: - First line: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Second line: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.6818, 0.1818] - Third line: Start Point [0.6818, 0.1818], End Point [0.0682, 0.1818] - Fourth line: Start Point [0.0682, 0.1818], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 6. Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with the following properties: - Depth towards normal: 0.2045 - Depth opposite normal: 0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 Part 2: Construct a smaller rectangular prism with intersecting faces. The second part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The front and back faces are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The dimensions of the prism are 0.3787 units in length, 0.1828 units in width, and 0.1828 units in height. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.375, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. 3. Sketch a quadrilateral as follows: - First line: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.1818, 0.0] - Second line: Start Point [0.1818, 0.0], End Point [0.1287, 0.1828] - Third line: Start Point [0.1287, 0.1828], End Point [0.0, 0.1402] - Fourth line: Start Point [0.0, 0.1402], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1828. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.375, 0.0, 0.0] 6. Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with the following properties: - Depth towards normal: 0.1894 - Depth opposite normal: 0.1894 - Sketch scale: 0.1828 The provided instructions outline the steps to construct the intermediate CAD parts and the final cad model from the given CAD Assembly JSON while following all the required instructions.</description>
